verses.verse: {The Lord Comes as Judge} d "Be silent before me, you coastlands, and let the people renew their strength! Let them come forward, then let them speak together let's draw near for a ruling.

Who has aroused victory from the east, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} has summoned it to his service, and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} has handed over nations to him? Who brings down kings, and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} turns them into dust with his sword, into windblown stubble with his bow?
And {So 1QIsa a LXX; the Heb. lacks and} who pursues them and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} moves on unscathed by a path that his feet don't know? {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads travel}
Who has performed and carried this out, calling the generations from the beginning? I, the Lord the first and will be with the last I am the One!"
{Idolators Encourage Each Other} d "The coastlands have looked and are afraid; the ends of the earth have drawn near together {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads earth tremble} and come forward.
Each helps his neighbor, saying {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT read and saying ; cf. LXX} to each other, «Be strong!'

The craftsman encourages the goldsmith, and the hammersmith {Lit. he who smoothes with the hammer} encourages the one who strikes the anvil. He says {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads saying} about the welding, «It's good!'and he reinforces it with nails so that it won't topple."
{The Lord Encourages Israel} d "But as for you, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I've chosen, the offspring of my friend Abraham
you whom I encouraged from the ends of the earth and called from its farthest corners, and told you, «You're my servant, I've chosen you and haven't cast you aside.'
Don't be afraid, because I'm with you; don't be anxious, because I am your God. I keep on strengthening you; I'm truly helping you. I'm surely upholding you with my victorious right hand."

{The Coming Defeat of God's Enemies} d "Look! All who are enraged at you will be put to shame and disgraced; those who contend with you will all die. {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads will become nothing and die ; cf. LXX}
Those who quarrel with you {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read You will seek them and not find those who quarrel with you} will be as nothing; those who fight you like nothing at all!"
{A Call to Courage} d "For I am the Lord your God, who takes hold of your right hand, who says to you, «Don't be afraid. I'll help you.

Don't be afraid, you little worm Jacob, and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} you insects of Israel! I myself will help you,'{1QIsa a is masculine; MT is feminine} declares the Lord, your {1QIsa a is masculine; MT is feminine} Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel."

{A Promise of Victory} d "See, I'm making you {1QIsa a is masculine; MT is feminine} into a new, sharp, and multi-tooth threshing sledge. You'll thresh and crush the mountains, and make the hills like chaff.

You'll winnow them, and the wind will lift them up, and a tempest will blow them away. Then you'll rejoice in the Lord , and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} you'll make your boast in the Holy One of Israel."

"As for the poor, the needy, those seeking {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read poor and the needy seeking} water when there is none and their tongues are parched from thirst I, the Lord , will answer them. I, the God of Israel, won't abandon them.

I'll open up rivers on the barren heights, and fountains in the midst of the valleys. I'll turn the {So 1QIsa a ; MT implies the} desert into a pool of water, and the parched land into springs of water.
I'll put cedar trees in the wilderness, along with acacia, myrtle, and olive trees. I'll plant cypresses in the desert box {Or elm} trees, and pine trees together

all so that people may see and recognize, perceive, {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa a corrector MT LXX read to consider} consider, and comprehend at the same time, that the hand of the Lord has done this, and that the Holy One of Israel has created it."
{Can God's Enemies Predict the Future?} d "Put forward your case!" says the Lord . "Submit your arguments!" says Jacob's King.

Let them approach and ask us, «What will happen? As to the former things, what were they? Tell us, so that we may consider them and know. Or {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads them. And we may know} the latter things or the things to come let us hear.

Tell us what the future holds, so we may know that you are gods! Yes, do something good or something bad, so we may hear {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads stare at one another ; cf. LXX} and gaze at it together.»"
"Look! You and your work are less than nothing; {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads you are nothing, and your work means nothing} whoever finds you pleasing is disgusting."

"You are stirring up {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read I am raising} one from the north, and they are coming {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads I am raising} from the rising of the sun; and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} he will be called by his {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read my} name. Rulers will arrive like mud; {I. e. like an overflowing river; so 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads He will come, rulers like mud} just {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and} like a potter, he will trample the clay.

Who told of this from the beginning, so we could know, or beforehand, so we could ask, «Is it right? '{So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads He was right} Indeed, no one told of this, no one made an announcement, and no one heard your words:
First, to Zion: "There is slumber." {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads look, there they are} And to Jerusalem: "I'll send a messenger with good news."
But when I look, there is no one among them there's no one to give counsel, no one to give an answer when I ask them.
See, none of them exist, and their deeds are nothing. {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads all of their works are utterly nothing} Their metal images are only wind and confusion.»"
